info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Cheshire, Hancock, East Windsor, Berkshire, Dalton, Lanesborough, Hinsdale, Windsor, Peru, The Boulders, Farnams, Coltsville, Adams Junction, Yankee Orchards, Victory Hill, Lakeview Terrace, Ponterril, Lakewood and Pontoosuc. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
